titleStmt.title: Cobbes prophecies his signes and tokens, his madrigalls, questions, and answeres, with his spirituall lesson, in verse, rime, and prose. Pleasant, and not vnprofitable. Reade that will, iudge that can, like that list.

publicationStmt.publisher: For Robert Wilson, and are to be sold at his shop in Grayes-Inne Gate,

notesStmt.note: "To the reader" is signed by Richard Rablet, who, according to Bullen, was "a fictitious personage".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
